issue.title: Gazebo crash at launch with a "Host not found"

content.raw:
I ran into both of these issues on Fedora 18.

The issue with boost filesystem v2 being removed from boost 1.50 can be worked around with the attached patch.  I'm not sure how long the v3 api has been around, so it may require ifdefing in to maintain compatibility with older boost releases.

The second issue is manifesting itself in Connection::GetLocalEndpoint().  Gazebo is trying to resolve a host_name which is my local computer's hostname (e.g. the contents of /etc/hostname).  For some reason, my system wasn't set up its own hostname, e.g. "getent hosts computername" returned nothing.  I think this is the same lack of result that boost is tripping over.  To work around, I added my computer's name to /etc/hosts, such that "getent hosts computername" returned 127.0.0.1.

I don't know if there's anything that could be fixed in Gazebo other than maybe trying to use "localhost" instead of the computer's unique hostname.
